intro: Galium congestum, commonly known as clustered bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems that form dense mats. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a soft, hairy texture. Galium congestum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
